stories.story: As a User, I want a red 'Download CSV' button at the bottom of the page, so that I can export my data

component.means: a red 'Download CSV' button at the bottom of the page

detected_violations.issue: The [Means] describes a specific UI element ('a red Download CSV button') and its placement, which is a solution rather than a problem/need.
detected_violations.suggestion: Restate the [Means] to describe the problem/need, e.g., 'I want to be able to export my data in a CSV format'.

detected_violations.issue: The [Ends] 'I can export my data' is somewhat vague and doesn't clearly express the benefit or rationale of solving the problem.
detected_violations.suggestion: Refine the [Ends] to clearly state the benefit, e.g., 'so that I can analyze it offline' or 'so that I can share it with others'.

stories.story: As a Customer, I want the system to use Redis caching, so that pages load faster

detected_violations.issue: Specifies a solution (Redis caching) instead of describing the user's problem/need
detected_violations.suggestion: Restate the problem/need, e.g., 'the system needs to improve page load performance'

stories.story: As a care professional I want to save a reimbursement. - Add save button on top right (never grayed out)

component.means: Add save button on top right (never grayed out)

detected_violations.issue: Specifies UI element (save button on top right) and its behavior (never grayed out), which is a solution
detected_violations.suggestion: Restate the problem/need without specifying UI or behavior, e.g., 'be able to save changes'

detected_violations.issue: Prescribes an implementation outcome (save a reimbursement) instead of the intended benefit
detected_violations.suggestion: Replace with the intended benefit, e.g., 'so that I can track my expenses'

stories.story: As a Shopper, I want to scan a QR code to pay, so that I can complete checkout quickly

component.means: scan a QR code to pay

detected_violations.issue: The [Means] describes a specific way of doing something (scanning a QR code) instead of just stating the problem or need.
detected_violations.suggestion: Restate the problem/need generically, e.g., 'make a payment'

stories.story: As a Student, I want to confirm my submission, so that I receive an immediate on-screen confirmation

component.ends: I receive an immediate on-screen confirmation

detected_violations.issue: Implicit solution hint: 'confirm my submission' implies a specific action or UI element.
detected_violations.suggestion: Restate the problem using a generic word, e.g., 'get assurance that my submission has been received'

detected_violations.issue: Prescribes implementation outcome: 'on-screen confirmation' implies a specific UI element.
detected_violations.suggestion: Replace with the intended benefit, e.g., 'so that I am assured my submission is received'

stories.story: As a Nurse, I want to be alerted about critical lab results, so that I can respond promptly

component.means: be alerted about critical lab results

stories.story: As a Customer, I want to access my data outside the system, so that I can perform further analysis

component.means: access my data outside the system

stories.story: As a Reader, I want to save interesting articles, so that I can find them later without searching again

component.ends: I can find them later without searching again
